trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Learningpool | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Learningpool | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Learningpool with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Learningpool with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Learningpool
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Learningpool

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Learningpool.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Learningpool.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Learningpool single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Learningpool single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Learningpool will be able to single sign into the application at your Learningpool company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Learningpool will be able to single sign into the application at your Learningpool company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Learningpool
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Learningpool

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Learningpool
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Learningpool

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Learningpool.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Learningpool.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Learningpool, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Learningpool, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Learningpool.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Learningpool.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Learningpool, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Learningpool, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learningpool</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learningpool</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Learningpool with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Learningpool with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Your Learningpool application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Learningpool application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Token Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Token Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Learningpool application integration page, in the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Learningpool application integration page, in the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Attribute Name
trans-unit.target: Attribute Name

trans-unit.source: Attribute Value
trans-unit.target: Attribute Value

trans-unit.source: User.userprincipalname
trans-unit.target: User.userprincipalname

trans-unit.source: User.givenname
trans-unit.target: User.givenname

trans-unit.source: User.mail
trans-unit.target: User.mail

trans-unit.source: urn:oid:2.5.4.4
trans-unit.target: urn:oid:2.5.4.4

trans-unit.source: User.surname
trans-unit.target: User.surname

trans-unit.source: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: From the Attribute Value list, select the attribute value shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: From the Attribute Value list, select the attribute value shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply Changes.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, click Back to open the Quick Start dialog again.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, click Back to open the Quick Start dialog again.

trans-unit.source: Click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Singel Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Singel Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Learningpool page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Learningpool page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Learningpool Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Learningpool application ( e.g.:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Learningpool Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Learningpool application ( e.g.:

trans-unit.source: https://parliament.preview.learningpool.com/auth/shibboleth/index.php), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: https://parliament.preview.learningpool.com/auth/shibboleth/index.php), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Learningpool page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Learningpool page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Forward that Metadata file to your Learningpool Support team.
trans-unit.target: Forward that Metadata file to your Learningpool Support team.

trans-unit.source: Single sign-on has to be enabled by the Learningpool support team.
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on has to be enabled by the Learningpool support team.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Learningpool, they must be provisioned into Learningpool.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Learningpool, they must be provisioned into Learningpool.

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Learningpool.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Learningpool.

trans-unit.source: Users need to be created by your Learningpool support team.
trans-unit.target: Users need to be created by your Learningpool support team.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Learningpool user account creation tools or APIs provided by Learningpool to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Learningpool user account creation tools or APIs provided by Learningpool to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Learningpool, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Learningpool, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Learningpool **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Learningpool **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
